page.title: 01Hills NE of Ballater
page.content: This area consists entirely of hillground on the north side of the glacially eroded Dee Valley. It is dissected by the deep, almost gorge like valley of the Tullich Burna and to the east by the valley of the smaller Coldstane Burn. Crannach Hill forms a barren steep sided ridge between these valleys. Its southern end is glacially truncated and scarred by a prominant sub glacial meltwater channel. The Coldstane Valley is a hanging valley. No one inhabits the area. Soil development is poor and peaty Crannach Hill has suffered from heather burning reducing much of it to bare rock and scree. Areas that have escaped burning show an unusually successful natural regeneration of pine trees. Birch woods are well established in the lower, sheltered parts of the area.
